name: Welcome
description:
A spoken word, media-rich poem about social anxiety by Ana Maria Caballero.

Caballero's writing has won the Beverly International Prize for Literature, Colombia's José Miguel Arango National Poetry Prize, been nominated for a Pushcart Prize + been a finalist for the Academy of American Poets Prize.

Her digital art was exhibited at Dreamverse and received a Sevens Foundation grant. Her NFTs are available via Fort Gallery NFT, MONOGRAMA NFT Gallery, Async.Art, KnownOrigin, and Foundation.

anamariacaballero.com 

--

Welcome

It’s not like I don’t
ask nice. Not like I
have more than one
 
shelf. Every day
I make room
for more dinner
 
plates. And every
afternoon, it is I
who sets them down.
 
Who offers you
or you or you
the chance to give
 
thanks. Be the
one to make
another fold their
 
hands. In my home,
it is you who hosts,
while I’m compelled
 
to be charmed.  Call it
grace. Call it world
talk. Call it an open
 
heart, straight teeth
that will always
call you back.
